description.narrative: The objective of this project is to achieve GHG emission reduction in Iran’s buildings sector. PPG Award 57216, Projects 70605 and 77389 Operationally closed on 16Nov2015 and Financially Closed 18Nov2015.

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: 1. No of MEEE policy document prepared 2. Number and scope of policies and innovative models on reducing air pollution on all populations, formulated, adopted and implemented. 1. CO2 emission reduction from implemented EE pilot projects at demo buildings 2. Number of new technologies adopted and scaled up that support more efficient energy use 3. Amount of CO2 equivalent mitigated and energy efficiency/achieved with a focus on residential sector 1. No. of Training centers for EEEB practitioners established. 2. Number of new partnerships for EE policy implementation

-Proposing enhancement of EE policies, laws, regulations and standards to ensure improved EE in building sector -Pre-feasibility study on the applicability of the W Cert market -EE Code enforcement system must be proposed -Reference test laboratory properly must be equipped -Connecting the selected pilot buildings to EMIS must be done -At least one EEEB projects must be facilitated, implemented and monitored under the CSSAP -MEEE policy recommendation must be adopted and used to reduce energy consumption. -successful ESCO business model must be provided -implementation of proposed solutions must be done -A reference document for 400 pilot Buildings selection must be developed for implementation -Developed training program in place must be done -operational financial schemes must be established -Local and international financial institutions providing financing for EEEB project

-2 EE policies, laws, regulations and standards improved EE in building sector
- 130,000 m2 public buildings are retrofitted in 2019 which is equal to 14,536 T CO2 reduction by 25% increasing of energy efficiency only in thermal sector.
- The expected amount of energy saving as a result of awareness creation including women, students and public parties (totally 7541 persons) is around 5% with penetration rate of 15% which is equal to 2,256,000 kWh and 3,384,000,000 Rial as finance benefit and 1180 tons of CO2 reduction in 2019
- National regulation of building Code (19th) recent modification has been done according to provided technical expertise of this project
- Market building and empowerment of energy service companies (ESCOs) has been done through the various types of trainings and workshops which have made them capable to have direct and indirect contracts with this project for 1,879,000 m2 of different buildings

- National platform of integrated building data monitoring and building energy identification system (EMIS-BEID) is established - One Standard on EE is developed and Energy Code is enforced - Number of Pilot Projects and saved energy - Shared-based ESCO business model is developed - Legal and regulatory frameworks of EE market is developed -Energy efficiency certificate scheme is submitted to government - M&V framework of building sector is developed

-The established national platform of integrated building data monitoring and building energy identification system (EMIS-BEID) and hosted by Building and Housing Research Center (BHRC), has been greatly enriched and developed by connecting more 400 existing and 18 newly constructed buildings through a proper institutional arrangement among Building and Housing research centre (BHRC), Tehran Municipality, mass constructor companies etc.
- New revision of the National energy labelling standard for non-residential buildings, #14254 is on the last steps in close collaboration of Iran National Standard Organization (INSO)
- Implementation of energy efficiency projects in 541 pilot buildings including 362 residential building with 3,000,000 m2 and 179 non-residential buildings with 723,000 m2 (Total for 5 years-Annual saved primary energy over 125,779 MWh )
- Fully implementation of shared-based ESCO business
-In operationalization of the EEE market, the legal and regulatory frameworks including following documents and enactments have been developed and approved
-Energy efficiency certificate scheme submitted to the energy saving commission, lower committee of Supreme Energy Council and approved by Supreme Economic Council
- M&V framework of building sector and structure of energy performance contract (EPC) developed in close co-operation with IFCO and SATBA when final draft submitted to the energy saving commission and approved by Supreme Energy Council on

- Two Policy updates proposed to Gov. - One EE Code enforcement system developed - Reference test laboratory properly equipped. - Connecting developed EMIS to pilot buildings and support establishment of EEE market - pilot projects implemented and monitored under the CSSAP - Three scope of policy tools adopted and used to reduce energy consumption. - Successful ESCO business model developed - Eight EE demonstration projects implemented - nZEB building designed and will be constructed - Implementation of EE measures and solutions in 400 pilot buildings completed - One scaling up policy proposed - 7 booklet and/or training materials provided and disseminated - 20 training courses conducted and delivered - Number of 10 ESCOs engaged in EE certificate model implementation - Level of public awareness about EEEB in different target group defined and reported - Three public awareness campaigns about EEB conducted - Three NGOs engaged in promoting sustainable energy use to households. - Two operational financial schemes established - Financial institutions providing financing for EEEB project

Outcome 1:
1. Institutional arrangements in place for effective energy monitoring through a national platform of integrated building data monitoring and building energy identification system (EMIS-BEID). This is (co) developed by the project and hosted by the Building and Housing Research Center (BHRC) on behalf of Ministry of Road and Urban Development and key stakeholders including the Ministry of Petroleum and Ministry of Power. The platform includes two modules 1) for adoption and enforcement of code 19th for new buildings and 2) for supporting national labelling standards for existing buildings. In addition, Market of energy efficiency and environment gas been considered by recording energy efficiency certificates. 2. The conservation building code (code 19th of building national regulation) was revised (4th edition) to address energy efficiency policy gaps and was ratified by Ministry of Road and Urban development in August 2020. This will achieve savings from 277 to 160 kWh/m2.yr in newly constructed buildings. The adaptation of newly constructed buildings with the requirements of the code will be based on four different rating systems and criteria including: 1) energy compliant (EC) building; 2) EC+ building; 3) EC++ building and 4) nearly zero energy building (ECnZ). 3. Trusted partnerships have been established to enable the enforcement of the National energy labelling standards for residential and non-residential buildings, #14253 and #14254 respectively. Such partnerships include Iran National Standard Organization (INSO), Iranian Fuel Conservation Company (IFCO), Renewable energy and Energy efficiency in electricity organization (SATBA) and Building and Housing research centre (BHRC). Partnerships will also pilot new revisions of existing standards for due implementation.
Outcome 2:
1. In total 184 Residential (892,471 m2) and 33 Public/state (247,855 m2) buildings have completed implementation. By pilot implementation, the following results have been achieved so far: - The deployment of a suite (13) of energy efficiency technologies across Tehran buildings including: 1) smart control system for heating cycle of the boiler house; 2) smart control for cooling cycle of the chiller house; 3) insulation material for boiler, piping, expansion tank and air channel; 4) anti-scale for heating cycle; 5) anti-scale for cooling cycle; 6) variable speed drive system for pumping; 7) high efficient electric motor; 8) variable speed drive system for cooling tower fan; 9) LED and SMD type lights; 10) central control system for lighting; 11) solar water heater (SWH); 12) solar photovoltaic (PV) system and 13) combined cooling, heat and power (CCHP) system. The adopted technologies will be scaled up through development of market of energy efficiency and environment and other policy tools that will be developed by the project and key stakeholders in the next year .
- The deployment of energy efficiency measures across Tehran buildings has resulted in emissions reduction of 1193 tonnes of CO2 equivalent (CO2teq) from the beginning of 2020 to November 2020. - The deployment of energy efficiency measures across Tehran buildings has resulted in energy savings of 8,136,893 kWh from the beginning of 2020 to November 2020. The positive views of building owners have been expressed through letters that illustrates the effectiveness of the pilot projects. - The design of two ESCO business models, in partnership with ESCO association and other stakeholders, and deployment through energy efficiency pilots. These models include the guarantee-based model used for public and Shared-based model applied for residential buildings. An assessment will be conducted of the most suited model(s) after full implementation of pilot project. As a result of a practicing mentioned ESCO business models in pilot projects, two new business models will be in place for the first time in the country level which will motivate building owners to contribute in financing in energy efficiency projects and facilitate implementation of the energy efficiency and environment market. The piloting of these two innovative business models provides new revenue streams for energy services companies in Tehran and provides new opportunities to trial ‘energy as a service’ in the Tehran energy efficiency market. As an example, in shared-based model, the financial contribution of building owners was 30% at the beginning of the pilot project, while it has increased to 70% by November 2020. In addition, the result of this practice will be used as a template contract of the energy efficiency in building sector within the energy efficiency and environment market. - The number of 10 energy efficiency demonstration projects [Insulation in 108 buildings (1), Combined Cooling Heating Power (3), Solar Water Heater (3) and Building Energy Management System (3)] has been implemented through pilot projects. By implementing this projects, 25% energy saving in pilot buildings and improvement in the associated indicator (from 277 to 208 kWh/m2. yr) will be achieved. It is expected that by verifying the results after, in total 36,380,000 kWh/yr energy will be saved which would be equivalent to around 2,000 tonnes of CO2 emission reduction per year.
Outcome 3:
1. The creation of the energy efficiency and environment market in Tehran requires the development of several regulations. Based on the gap analysis from the market by-law, three studies have been defined to respond to the market development including: - Cost Benefit Analysis (CBA): CBA as a method of quantifying socio-enviro-economic benefits of energy efficiency, represents non-energy benefits of energy efficiency along with only energy benefits in order to enhancing awareness and engagement of the stakeholders to take the responsibility in implementing and establishing of market for energy efficiency and environment. By using this tool, it is expected that the awareness of relevant people of stakeholders on multiple benefits of energy efficiency will be increased by 50% in one-year period. - Monitoring, Verification and Reporting (MRV): Developing a MRV framework mechanism is a requirement for implementation of market for energy efficiency and environment according to the market by-law. As a result of this study, the required work instruction for implementation of MRV system for verification of energy saving and carbon dioxide emission reduction will be available in order to issue the white certificates; - The study of “legal and regulatory framework for establishment of market of energy efficiency and environment” aims to develop required regulatory, legal and financial frameworks and models as well as executing instructions for establishment and implementation of the market. Thereafter, those instructions will be passed to the relevant stakeholders for the regulatory purposes. By completing this study, two main work instructions including: 1) energy performance contracting and 2) financial models for energy efficiency and environment market will be passed through planning and budgeting organization. 2. Training and capacity building: Eleven courses in several fields of energy efficiency have been delivered since the beginning of 2020 were in total to 1480 participants including 514 women and 966 men in five key subjects. These courses were provided with the objective to facilitate enforcement of code 19th, to develop new energy businesses and start-up companies with the ideas to fill the technical gaps in line with the capacity building of energy efficiency services businesses and facilitate implementation of market for energy efficiency and environment. According to the field survey from 35 participants (around 2.5% of the total), it is estimated that the knowledge level has increased by 40%.
-Project Closure including Terminal Evaluation and Financial closure - Holding last steering committee and project closure ceremony - Preparation of exit strategy
